title: Job-to-resume matching and application workflow app (manual location + editable resume/cover letter)

requirements.text: Implement authenticated per-user data storage for resume text, cover letter text, and user-specified location (city/region + optional radius) so the app can persist and reload a user’s job-search materials across sessions.

quotes: Create an app that automatically matches jobs and resume from locations near me and apply.
Should have an option to edit cover letter and resume if needed.
Create an app that matches job description with resume and applies automatically.

acceptanceCriteria: User can sign in (using the project’s existing Internet Identity flow) and see only their own saved resume/cover letter/location data.
User can create/update/save resume text and cover letter text.
User can set location as text input (e.g., City, State/Country) and optionally a numeric radius (miles/km).
Data remains available after refresh/reload.

requirements.text: Add a job intake feature that lets a user create job entries with at least: title, company, location text, job description, and an optional application URL/contact details, so the app has job descriptions to match against the user’s resume.

quotes: Create an app that automatically matches jobs and resume from locations near me and apply.
Create an app that matches job description with resume and applies automatically.

acceptanceCriteria: User can add, edit, and delete job entries.
Job entry form includes fields: title, company, location (text), job description (large text), and optional application URL.
Jobs list view shows saved jobs and supports basic search (by title/company).

requirements.text: Implement a deterministic matching/scoring system that compares each saved job description to the user’s saved resume and produces a match score plus a short list of matched keywords/phrases used to justify the score.

quotes: Create an app that automatically matches jobs and resume from locations near me and apply.
Create an app that matches job description with resume and applies automatically.

acceptanceCriteria: For each job, the UI displays a numeric match score (e.g., 0–100) computed from resume text vs. job description text.
The job detail view shows an explanation section listing matched keywords/terms contributing to the score.
User can sort jobs by match score (descending).

requirements.text: Add location filtering based on the user’s manually entered location and the job’s location text, supporting at minimum: (a) show only jobs whose location text contains the user’s location string, and (b) show all jobs when location filter is disabled.

quotes: Create an app that automatically matches jobs and resume from locations near me and apply.

acceptanceCriteria: User can toggle location filtering on/off.
When enabled, jobs list filters to those whose location text matches the user-entered location string (case-insensitive).
When disabled, all jobs are shown.

requirements.text: Create an application workflow per job that can generate an application draft containing: resume text, cover letter text (editable), and a submission checklist; support marking a job as 'Applied' and storing application history/status per job.

quotes: Should have an option to edit cover letter and resume if needed.
Create an app that matches job description with resume and applies automatically.

acceptanceCriteria: From a job detail page, user can open an 'Apply' flow that shows the current resume and an editable cover letter for that application.
User can save an application draft without marking as applied.
User can mark the job as 'Applied' and the UI reflects applied status in the job list.
Backend stores per-job application status and timestamps for the signed-in user.

requirements.text: If a job has an application URL, provide a 'Go to Application' action that opens the URL in a new tab, and record that the user initiated the application from the app; do not attempt to automate third-party form submission without explicit user-provided API endpoints.
acceptanceCriteria: Job detail shows a button/link to open the application URL when present.
Clicking the action opens the URL in a new tab/window.
The app records an event/timestamp that the user opened the application link for that job.

requirements.text: Choose and apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a productivity/job-tracking app, and enforce it consistently across all pages.

quotes: Create an app that automatically matches jobs and resume from locations near me and apply.
Create an app that matches job description with resume and applies automatically.

acceptanceCriteria: All core screens (Resume, Cover Letter, Jobs list, Job detail/Apply flow) share consistent styling.
Theme does not rely on blue/purple as the primary palette.
Layouts are responsive and usable on mobile widths.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor).
Do not edit files under frontend paths marked immutable by the platform (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not use geolocation/GPS; 'near me' must be supported via manual location input.
Do not integrate external LLM/AI services; implement matching without OpenAI/Anthropic/other AI service integrations.
No third-party authentication providers; use Internet Identity only.
nonGoals: Scraping job boards or integrating specific job board APIs without user-provided endpoints and credentials.
Fully automated third-party job application form submission (auto-filling and submitting on external sites).
Parsing PDF/DOC resumes; initial version uses plain text resume/cover letter inputs.
